text: The Athens Olympic Aquatic Centre is a building at the Athens Olympic Sports Complex. It has one pool indoors and two pools outdoors. The centre was built for the Mediterranean Games in 1991. The centre was expanded for the 2004 Olympic Games. During the Olympics, the outdoor pools hosted swimming, water polo, and syncronized swimming. The indoor pool hosted diving events. As of 2015, the outdoor pools are now used for public swimming programs. == References == Category:Athens
title: Athens Olympic Aquatic Centre
